captions.text: A beacon to return to a place and myself.

a natural richness that
over time has quietly become the true currency of life.
And this place is the kingdom of abundance.

British Columbia forces you to rethink
life's measures.
The thread that connects us all is undeniable in this place
that the Aboriginal peoples have honoured for millennia.
Massive groves. Standing giants, fed by the climate and the circle of life.
Altitude swings that take you from sea
This is the place where wildlife thrives.
All in the court of her majesty, Mother Nature.
She chose this place to erect her monuments,
A dichotomy that reflects our refined civilization
It's the rush of standing on the edge of the world.
The deafening quiet of a mystical morning.

The exhilaration of British
Columbia that reminds you
of what it feels like to be alive.

title: The Wild Within: British Columbia, Canada

comments.text:
AMAZING visuals with a PREPOSTEROUS script - full of trendy bravado,

final mission accomplished: get people excited. BC is truly stunning.﻿

comments.text:
After 1year in Toronto we took 15 days to visit Vancouver And it was the 
most beautiful experience ever... Sea to the sky : whistler highway.. 
Hiking, beaches, nature. Views...Granville market , Stanley park, grouse 
mountain, suspension bridge.. :).And especially The People we met. If the 
weather was better i LL definitely live there 4ever! We Did a canadian And 
a north America trip... But BC was THE Best experience...you ll find there 
the wild within!﻿

comments.text:
Vorsicht, Fernweh! Die kanadische Provinz British Columbia hat bei der 
diesjährigen internationale Fachmesse für Reise und Touristik (ITB) in 
Berlin den ersten Preis in der Kategorie „Region International“ gewonnen. 
Völlig zurecht wie wir finden! Das neue Image-Video „The Wild Within" 
wollten wir den "Kanada-Schwärmern" unter euch deshalb nicht vorenthalten: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dNFrZNjs2ng&feature=youtu.be﻿

comments.author: Vancouver Island Lifestyle - Beltgens Properties

comments.text:
BC is...where Robert Dziekański was tasered and killed by RCMP Officer(s) 
on October 14, 2007, while having been lost at the Vancouver Airport, 
waiting for his mum to show up and pick him after 20 hours flight from 
Poland. It was his first visit to this beautiful province, and what an 
irony, in his back pocket they found a copy of National Geographic issue 
with a picture of British Columbia and title 'Beautiful British Columbia!!! 
Poor, poor guy. ﻿

comments.author: Jhon shadowz

comments.text:
So incredibly beautiful - I lived on Lulu Island (now Richmond?) on a 
Blueberry farm while my Dad was a student at UBC. Now we are in southern 
Ontario. Your films are astonishingly (word?) moving - am almost tearful 
watching them. They remind me of the real wealth of Canada and the riches 
we should be pursuing. The language and the voice over is ...  who the 
blazes wrote them? So moving - can we say one picture is worth a thousand 
words?  Not in these ads I - such beautiful language. Well, thanks for 
breaking my heart - ex B.C. resident (now retired Senior Citizen in 
Windsor, On)﻿

comments.author: darren mcgovern

comments.text:
Please start working together to heal our land, YOU'RE ONLY MAKING MATTER 
WORSE.
My first thought about this video was- Wow! I am lucky to live in a 
beautiful province. Can it get any better than this? Well that's just it,  
it cannot, it only gets more defective with people being curious and 
exploring. OUR GRASSLAND NEEDS TO HEAL, alright. It can only recover in 
time. So please adventurers deferment, let B.C have a rest. May we give 
this beautiful British Columbia a break, please!

 I  glanced at someone's  comment saying, come see us now while it is still 
here. Because it won't be like this for much longer. ( btw that was a 6o 
year old business man ) That must've been the most abominable comment 've 
ever grasp mentally.  You know seeing is believing and seeing this land in 
believable, right. Well  we need to  believe our land WILL make it.  IT 
WILL FIGHT THROUGH THE POLUTION IT BREATHS AND EVERYTHING ELES 
THAT PRESENTS IT WITH HARM.... It's all in our heads.  If people continue 
to make nasty comment that begins with our thoughts. it wont make it! Its 
that simple cause we didn't have faith. We'll be at fault because not many 
of us hoped for the best, not many of our actions were use to help make 
this a better place.  The population on this earth is only growing 
bigger while our little world, in a growing galaxy, stays the same.. We 
need to change. Let us start suffering now! As many of us already are. But 
why not let the ones, living life to the fullest,  with all there money 
they worked for,  suffer as well. Cause correct me if I am wrong those are 
the ones doing the most harm....﻿

comments.author: Andrew Stordy

comments.text:
Okay, so I was hoping to be amazed and I can't deny the shots they took are 
beautiful, but the video just wasn't as inspirational as I was hoping. But 
they got their slogan SPOT ON. "Super Natural British Columbia". That will 
sell fast.
The trending popularity of "natural" and "wholesome" concepts are sought 
out for. Super green visions are carried out by most Vancouverites. The 
monologue is poetic and it works well, but it should have been a male 
narrator honestly. It would have been more spell-binding.﻿
comments.author: Maria L

comments.text: God this is such a powerful video ... i hope to one day go there ﻿

comments.text: Love my home. So privileged to have been raised here.﻿
comments.author: Joel Sawley

comments.text:
BC is a beautiful place.  Too Bad you focused on only one small portion. 
 Would be nice to celebrate the only intact grasslands in the world, the 
only inland temperate rainforest in the world, the interior plateau 
country, the interior valleys and montagne regions.  BC is so much MORE 
than Lower Mainland coast mountains and Great Bear Rainforest.  Why would 
you show this in Prince George at the winter games?....it's an insult to PG 
too﻿

comments.author: DMJ FILMS

comments.text:
It is beautiful and showcases portions of B.C.'s beauty, but if they are 
trying to also feature our biodiversity and geographical diversity, they 
skimped on the grasslands, desert, underwater marine, Garry Oak meadows and 
boreal forest. I know rock and ice sells, but that doesn't speak to me 
about our amazing diversity and perhaps more subtle beauty. Not that there 
is anything subtle about a Garry Oak meadow or grassland in bloom!﻿

comments.author: Fabienne Chaber

comments.text:
So can we protect the little thats left ! The tiny teeny amount of wild 
uncut forests ? There are no massive groves left ! I have been in every 
corner of this province and it has been logged and mined and fished and 
tainted by mans hand in all of those corners. And at a ever increased rated 
the last of nature is forced out by our huge growing population ! Growth is 
all that is ever talked about by politicians and we need to conserve and 
stop population growth ! Theres enough of us here ! ﻿

comments.author: João Leitão

comments.text:
How does Enbridge, Kinder Morgan, and dirty bitumen fit into this? Can we 
see a mock up of Pacific Rim National Park covered in oily sludge? Or an 
oil tanker aground in the Haida Gwaii?

Great propaganda, and it's a great juxtaposition to the current dirty 
resource-extraction economy that is being pushed by the province and the 
Conservative federal government.﻿

comments.author: Destination British Columbia

comments.text:
HM, can be improved on dramatically, for every country offers a nature, 
activity, hiking and spots, you got to make BC more appetizing to larger 
audience, hardly possible with slow, boring speech and music that belongs 
to a funeral home. 

Sorry for my bluntness, but i'll try to make a video about British Columbia 
using publicly available footage and than put it together to create a nice 
video, but this time I'll do it on a shoe string budget and with limited 
resources, mainly to prove my point, a great add/video can be done for a 
peanuts if you hit all the right spots. 

Canada is one of the most wondrous places on this little blue rock we all 
cohabit, BC imho is its jewel in the crown you should really try to play 
this bit. ﻿
comments.author: mic of orion

comments.author: OttawaAccoustics

comments.text:
Hey there! We were able to look into this for you and find out that no 
drones were used in shooting the video, as all of the footage was shot on 
the ground using licensed helicopters equipped for high definition filming. 
Hope this helps! :)

comments.text:
" As I grow to understand life less and less, I learn to live it more and more."- Jules Renard. Life and nature are two things that bound to be connected to one another, to support one another and lastly, to be living in harmony with each other. The "Super, natural" British Colombia truly amazes you and makes you feel like conquering the mountain of life, and finding back what are missing in your life and its meaning and from that, appreciate the life that you have been given. A nature's masterpiece.
-Kim Lee
